description: Getty Images is among the world’s leading creators and distributors of award-winning still imagery, video, music and multimedia products, as well as other forms of premium digital content, available through its trusted house of brands, including iStock and Thinkstock.
steps: After creation app, you will receive clientKey and clientSecret
For getting accessToken use getResourceOwnerGrant or getAccessToken endpoints

blocks.name: getAccessToken
blocks.description: Client Credentials grant is for client applications that will not have individual users. An application token is created and limits the client application to operations that do not need user credentials. A Sandbox application (for trial development and without a licensing agreement) can only use the Client Credential grant type.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Client API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Client API Secret.

blocks.name: getResourceOwnerGrant
blocks.description: The Resource Owner grant is only for Getty Images and Getty Images partner applications. This grant type is suitable for clients capable of obtaining the resource owner's credentials.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Client API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Client API Secret.

args.name: username
args.info: User Name.

args.name: password
args.info: User Password.

blocks.name: refreshToken
blocks.description: A refresh token is obtained when authorizing through the the Resource Owner grant. The refresh token is good for one year and can be used to retrieve another 30-minute access token by calling the token endpoint.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Client API Key.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Client API Secret.

args.name: refreshToken
args.info: Refresh token obtained from Resource Owner grant call.

blocks.name: getEventsBySearchQuery
blocks.description: Use this endpoint to search Getty Images news, sports and entertainment events. Getty Images photographers and videographers cover editorially relevant events occurring around the world.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Provide your API key.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Provide a header to specify the language of result values.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Provide access token.

args.name: dateFrom
args.info: Filters to events that start on or after this date.

args.name: dateTo
args.info: Filters to events that start on or before this date.

args.name: editorialSegment
args.info: Filters to events with a matching editorial segment.

args.name: fields
args.info: Specifies fields to return.

args.name: phrase
args.info: Filters to events related to this phrase.

args.name: page
args.info: Request results starting at a page number (default is 1, maximum is 50).

args.name: pageSize
args.info: Request number of images to return in each page.

blocks.name: getImagesBySearchQuery
blocks.description: Use this endpoint to search over a blend of our contemporary stock photos, illustrations, archival images, editorial photos, illustrations and archival images.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Provide your API key.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Provide a header to specify the language of result values.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Provide access token.

args.name: ageOfPeople
args.info: Filter based on the age of individuals in an image.

args.name: artists
args.info: Search for images by specific artists.

args.name: collectionCodes
args.info: Filter by collection codes. Include or exclude based on collections_filter_type.

args.name: collectionsFilterType
args.info: Provides searching based on specified collection(s).

args.name: color
args.info: Filter based on predominant color in an image. Use 6 character hexidecimal format (e.g., #002244). Note: when specified, results will not contain editorial images

args.name: compositions
args.info: Filter based on image composition.

args.name: embedContentOnly
args.info: Restrict search results to embeddable images. The default is false.

args.name: ethnicity
args.info: Filter search results based on the ethnicity of individuals in an image.

args.name: eventIds
args.info: Filter based on specific events

args.name: excludeNudity
args.info: Excludes images containing nudity. The default is false.

args.name: fields
args.info: Specifies fields to return. Defaults to 'summary_set'.

args.name: fileTypes
args.info: Return only images having a specific file type.

args.name: graphicalStyles
args.info: Filter based on graphical style of the image.

args.name: keywordIds
args.info: Return only images tagged with specific keyword(s). If keyword Ids and phrase are both specified, only those images matching the query phrase which also contain the requested keyword(s) are returned.

args.name: licenseModels
args.info: Specifies the image licensing model(s).

args.name: minimumSize
args.info: Filter based on minimum size requested

args.name: numberOfPeople
args.info: Filter based on the number of people in the image.

args.name: orientations
args.info: Return only images with selected aspect ratios.

args.name: phrase
args.info: Search images using a search phrase.

args.name: prestigeContentOnly
args.info: Restrict search results to prestige images. The default is false.

args.name: productTypes
args.info: Filter images to those having product types from the selected list.

args.name: specificPeople
args.info: Return only images associated with specific people.

args.name: page
args.info: Request results starting at a page number (default is 1, maximum is 50).

args.name: pageSize
args.info: Request number of images to return in each page.

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: Select sort order of results.

blocks.name: getImages
blocks.description: This endpoint returns the detailed image metadata for all specified images. Due to a wide variety of available image resolutions, the images are grouped into a handful of size categories for simplicity.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Provide your API key.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Provide a header to specify the language of result values.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Provide access token.

args.name: fields
args.info: Specifies fields to return. Defaults to 'summary_set'.

args.name: imageIds
args.info: Specifies one or more image ids to return.

blocks.name: getImage
blocks.description: This endpoint returns the detailed image metadata for a specified image. Due to a wide variety of available image resolutions, the images are grouped into a handful of size categories for simplicity.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Provide your API key.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Provide a header to specify the language of result values.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Provide access token.

args.name: fields
args.info: Specifies fields to return. Defaults to 'summary_set'.

args.name: imageId
args.info: An image id. For more than one image please use the /v3/images endpoint.

blocks.name: getSimilarImage
blocks.description: This endpoint will search our asset database for images similar to the specified asset id. Due to a wide variety of available image resolutions, the images are grouped into a handful of size categories for simplicity.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Provide your API key.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Provide a header to specify the language of result values.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Provide access token.

args.name: fields
args.info: Specifies fields to return. Defaults to 'summary_set'.

args.name: imageId
args.info: An image id. For more than one image please use the /v3/images endpoint.

args.name: page
args.info: Request results starting at a page number (default is 1, maximum is 50).

args.name: pageSize
args.info: Request number of images to return in each page.

blocks.name: getVideos
blocks.description: Use this endpoint to return detailed video metadata for all the specified video ids.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Provide your API key.

args.name: acceptLanguage

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Provide access token.

args.name: fields
args.info: Specifies fields to return. Defaults to 'summary_set'.

args.name: videoIds
args.info: Specifies one or more video ids to return.

blocks.name: getVideo
blocks.description: Use this endpoint to return detailed video metadata for the specified video id.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Provide your API key.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Provide a header to specify the language of result values.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Provide access token.

args.name: fields
args.info: List of fields to retrive for the video.

args.name: videoId
args.info: A video id.

blocks.name: getPreviousDownloadsInfo
blocks.description: Returns information about a customer's previously downloaded assets.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Provide your API key.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Provide access token.

args.name: dateFrom
args.info: Filters to events that start on or after this date.

args.name: dateTo
args.info: Filters to events that start on or before this date.

args.name: companyDownloads
args.info: If specified, returns the list of previously downloaded images for all users in your company. Your account must be enabled for this functionality. Contact your Getty Images account rep for more information. Default is false.

args.name: page
args.info: Request results starting at a page number (default is 1, maximum is 50).

args.name: productType
args.info: Specifies product type to be included in the previous download results.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: Request number of images to return in each page.

blocks.name: downloadImage
blocks.description: Use this endpoint to generate download URLs and related data for images you are authorized to download.Most product offerings have enforced periodic download limits such as monthly, weekly, and daily. When this operation executes, the count of allowed downloads is decremented by one for the product offering. Once the download limit is reached for a given product offering, no further downloads may be requested for that product offering until the next download period.The download limit for a given download period is covered in your product agreement established with Getty Images.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Provide your API key.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Provide access token.

args.name: imageId
args.info: Id of image to download.

args.name: fileType
args.info: File Type expressed with three character file extension.

args.name: height
args.info: Specifies the pixel height of the particular image to download. Available heights can be found in the images/{ids} response for the specific image. If left blank, it will return the largest available size.

args.name: productId
args.info: Identifier of the instance for the selected product offering type.

args.name: downloadNotes
args.info: Associate a note with the download of an image.

args.name: projectCode
args.info: Specifies the associated project code saved with the downloaded of an image.

args.name: productType
args.info: Specifies product type to be included in the previous download results.

blocks.name: downloadVideo
blocks.description: Use this endpoint to generate download URLs and related data for videos you are authorized to download.Most product offerings have enforced periodic download limits such as monthly, weekly, and daily. When this operation executes, the count of allowed downloads is decremented by one for the product offering. Once the download limit is reached for a given product offering, no further downloads may be requested for that product offering until the next download period.The download limit for a given download period is covered in your product agreement established with Getty Images.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Provide your API key.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Provide access token.

args.name: videoId
args.info: Id of video to download.

args.name: size
args.info: Specifies the size to be downloaded.

args.name: productId
args.info: Identifier of the instance for the selected product offering type.

args.name: productType
args.info: Specifies product type to be included in the previous download results.

blocks.name: getBoards
blocks.description: Boards are where you collect, curate, collaborate on and manage photo and video assets in one place. More information on the Boards FAQ. Use this endpoint to retrieve all Boards available for a user.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Provide your API key.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Provide access token.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Provide a header to specify the language of result values.

args.name: boardRelationship
args.info: Search for boards the user owns or has been invited to as an editor.

args.name: page
args.info: Request results starting at a page number (default is 1, maximum is 50).

args.name: pageSize
args.info: Request number of images to return in each page.

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: Sort the list of boards by last update date or name. Defaults to date_last_updated_descending.

blocks.name: createBoard
blocks.description: Boards are where you collect, curate, collaborate on and manage photo and video assets in one place. More information on the Board FAQ. Use this endpoint to create a Board by a specific id.

args.info: Provide your API key.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Provide access token.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Provide a header to specify the language of result values.

args.name: name
args.info: Board name.

args.name: boardDescription
args.info: Board description.

args.name: accessToken

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Provide a header to specify the language of result values.

args.name: boardId
args.info: Specify the board to update.

args.name: name
args.info: New board name.

args.name: boardDescription
args.info: new board description.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Provide a header to specify the language of result values.

args.name: boardId

args.name: accessToken

args.name: acceptLanguage

blocks.name: addBoardAssets
blocks.description: Boards are where you collect, curate, collaborate on and manage photo and video assets in one place. More information on the Boards FAQ. Use this endpoint to add a set of assets to a board.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Provide your API key.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Provide access token.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Provide a header to specify the language of result values.

args.name: boardId

blocks.name: deleteBoardAssets
blocks.description: Boards are where you collect, curate, collaborate on and manage photo and video assets in one place. More information on the Boards FAQ. Use this endpoint to add a set of assets to a board.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Provide your API key.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Provide access token.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Provide a header to specify the language of result values.

args.name: boardId
args.info: Specify the board to remove assets from.

args.name: assetsIds
args.info: List the assets to be removed from the board.

blocks.name: addAssetToBoard
blocks.description: Boards are where you collect, curate, collaborate on and manage photo and video assets in one place. More information on the Boards FAQ. Use this endpoint to add an asset to a board.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Provide your API key.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Provide access token.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Provide a header to specify the language of result values.

args.name: boardId
args.info: Specify the board to add an asset to.

args.name: assetId
args.info: Specify the asset to add to the board. If it is already in the board's asset collection, no action is taken.

blocks.name: deleteAssetToBoard
blocks.description: Boards are where you collect, curate, collaborate on and manage photo and video assets in one place. More information on the Boards FAQ. Use this endpoint to remove an asset from a board.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Provide your API key.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Provide access token.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Provide a header to specify the language of result values.

args.name: boardId
args.info: Specify the board to remove an asset from.

args.name: assetId
args.info: Specify the asset to add to the board. If it is already in the board's asset collection, no action is taken.

blocks.name: getBoardComments
blocks.description: Boards are where you collect, curate, collaborate on and manage photo and video assets in one place. More information on the Boards FAQ. Use this endpoint to retrieve all comments for a specific board.

args.info: Provide a header to specify the language of result values.

args.info: Comment text.

blocks.name: deleteBoardComments
blocks.description: Boards are where you collect, curate, collaborate on and manage photo and video assets in one place. More information on the Boards FAQ. Use this endpoint to delete a comment from a board.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Provide your API key.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Provide access token.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Provide a header to specify the language of result values.

args.name: boardId
args.info: Specify the board containing the comment to delete.

args.name: commentId
args.info: Specify the comment to delete.

blocks.name: getEvents
blocks.description: This endpoint returns the detailed event metadata for all specified events. Getty Images news, sports and entertainment photographers and videographers cover editorially relevant events occurring around the world.See more in readme.

args.name: accessToken

args.name: acceptLanguage

args.info: list of event ids.

blocks.name: getProducts
blocks.description: This endpoint returns all products available to the username used during authentication. As such, this endpoint requires the use of a fully authorized access_token. The product data can then be used as search filters, restricting results to images from a specific product.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Provide your API key.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Provide access token.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Provide a header to specify the language of result values.

args.name: fields
args.info: list of fields to return in the response.

blocks.name: getPreviouslyPurchasedAssets
blocks.description: This endpoint returns a list of all assets purchased on gettyimages.com by the username used for authentication. Use of this endpoint requires configuration changes to your API key. Please contact developersupport@gettyimages.com to learn more.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Provide your API key.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Provide access token.

args.name: dateFrom
args.info: If specified, retrieves previous purchases on or after this date.

args.name: dateTo
args.info: If specified, retrieves previous purchases on or before this date.

args.name: page
args.info: Request results starting at a page number (default is 1, maximum is 50).

args.name: pageSize
args.info: Request number of images to return in each page.

blocks.name: GetPreviousPurchases

args.name: page

args.name: pageSize

blocks.name: reportUsage
blocks.description: Use this endpoint to report the usages of a set of assets. The count of assets submitted in a single batch to this endpoint is limited to 1000. Note that all asset Ids specified must be valid or the operation will fail causing no usages to be recorded. In this case, you will need to remove the invalid asset Ids from the query request and re-submit the query.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Provide your API key.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Provide access token.

args.name: acceptLanguage
args.info: Provide a header to specify the language of result values.

args.name: reportId
args.info: Specifies a unique batch transaction id to identify the report.

args.name: assetUsages
args.info: Identifies the list of asset id, usage count and date of usage combinations to record.

structure.name: assetId
structure.info: Specifies the Id of the asset that was used.

structure.name: quantity
structure.info: Specifies the number of times the asset was used.

structure.name: usageDate
structure.info: Specifies the number of times the asset was used.

args.name: batchSize
args.info: Specifies the number of assets to return. The default is 10; maximum is 500.
